* Exposes vims undo structure
* Vim maintains a tree of document state
	* Makes it much easier to access

* Demonstration

* >< marks current state
* {} next redo state
* [] the latest state
* s save points
* S latest save point

* u undo
* ctrl-r redo

* persisent undo

* enter Move to current state
* < move to previous save
* > move to next save
* J move to previous
* K move to next
* D toggle diff
* T toggle timestamp
* C clear undo
* tab focus back on editor
